summary: The East Palestine Health Impact Monitoring Act of 2025 mandates a longitudinal study on the human health effects resulting from the February 3, 2023, train derailment in East Palestine, Ohio. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will award a grant to a consortium of higher education institutions to conduct the study. The Secretary is required to submit reports to congressional committees on the study's progress and findings, including any planned follow-up actions. Funding is authorized for fiscal year 2026, remaining available until September 30, 2030.
